subtitle.line: Klovnens fest
La Fiesta del Payaso
Een feestje met een clown

line.words: One day Peter gets an invitation. An invitation to a party. But it isn’t one of his friend’s parties. It is from a clown!

line.words: It is a fancy dress party. Peter decides to go as a fearsome warrior. He paints his face. He looks strong and terrifying!

line.words: Peter arrives at the party. All of his friends are there. Everybody from his class is there. And the clown is there.

line.words: §Hello everybody!§ Says the clown. §My name is Carlos clown. Today I am 8 years old, and this is a party you will never ever forget!§

line.words: Peter feels uneasy. §Something is not right about this clown,§ he says to Amy. But Amy is playing with the balloons.

line.words: Peter goes into the garden. There is a bouncy castle. Everyone is having fun. §Maybe everything is fine,§ thinks Peter.

line.words: But then the games start. First they play musical chairs. Jane wins. Then they play pass the parcel. John wins. Everything seems fine until they play musical statues.

line.words: As they are playing, Peter notices that one by one, his friends are all turning to stone! He looks at the clown. Carlos the clown is laughing nastily.

subtitle.line: Mientras están jugando, Pedro nota que uno a uno se convierten en estatuas de piedra. Él mira al payaso. Carlos el payaso se está riendo.

line.words: §I am going to steal your imaginations so that I can create the funniest jokes!§ cackles the clown.

subtitle.line: ‘voy a robar tu imaginación para crear bromas más graciosas’ El payaso ríe (ja, ja, ja!)

‘voy a robar tu imaginación para crear bromas más graciosas’ El payaso ríe (ja, ja, ja!)

line.words: Lucky that Peter is dressed as a fearsome warrior. It makes him feel brave. It makes him feel strong. He roars, §Set them free! Set them free now!§

subtitle.line: Suerte que Pedro está disfrazado de guerrero. Le hace sentirse más valiente. Le hace sentirse más fuerte. Él grita ‘¡libéralos, libéralos ahora!

line.words: Peter’s friends return to normal. The clown starts to cry. §I’m sorry. I just want to be really good at something like you all are.§

subtitle.line: Los amigos de Pedro vuelven a ser normales. El payaso empieza a llorar. ‘Lo siento. Yo solo quiero ser bueno en algo como todos vosotros’

line.words: §I swim well,§ says Amy. §I dance well,§ says Tariq. §And I play football well,§ says Xavier.

subtitle.line: ‘nado bien’ dice Amy‘bailo bien’ dice Tariq ‘juego al fútbol bien’ dice Javier’

line.words: §But you are also good at something, clown!§ says Peter. You are fantastic at organising parties!§ §Yeah it is true!§ agrees Amy. §This was the best party ever– until you turned us to stone!§

subtitle.line: ‘¡pero tú eres bueno en algo, payaso!’ dice Pedro. ¡Eres bueno organizando fiestas!¡es verdad! Amy está de acuerdo. ‘Esta ha sido una fiesa muy divertida hasta que nos convertiste en piedra!’
泽维尔说: “我足球踢得好”.彼得说: “但是,小丑你也擅长一类活动. 你很善于组织派对!” 艾米同意，并说: “这是真的. 这是最好的派对. 直到你把我们变成石头!”
‘¡pero tú eres bueno en algo, payaso!’ dice Pedro. ¡Eres bueno organizando fiestas!¡es verdad! Amy está de acuerdo. ‘Esta ha sido una fiesa muy divertida hasta que nos convertiste en piedra!’

‘Mais tu es bon à quelque chose le clown!’, dit Pierre. ‘Tu es génial pour organiser les fêtes!’ ‘C’est vrai!’, dit Aimée. C’était la meilleure fête de tous les temps – jusqu’à ce que tu nous transformes en pierre!’
§ولكن أنت جيد في شيء ، يا مهرج!§قال بيتر أنت عظيم في تنظيم الحفلات! هذا صحيح! §تتفق أيمي. كانت هذه أحسن حفلة-- إلى أن حولتنا إلى حجر '!

line.words: §It’s my party next week,§ says Peter. §Will you organise my birthday party? Please?§ §Oh, thank you!§ Says the clown. §I would love to!§

line.words: And because the clown felt important, he was never mean again. Well, not until Peter’s party next week.
